page.title: 03FRAMPTON COURT
page.content: The land farmed as Frampton Court Farm lies on either side of the busy Tewkesbury to Stow-on-the-Wold road. It is a mixed farm, about half of the land is planted to cereal crops mainly wheat and barley. The other half is divided equally between silage and hay (winter feed for the cattle) and grazing for the dairy herd of Guernseys and Freisians. The milk produced by the cows used to be bottled on the premises but is now collected daily by tanker and taken to the local dairy to be bottled and distributed. The farm is highly mechanised using tractors and much specialised machinery so that the work is done more quickly and effectively.
